questions.question: Which of the following best describes a trust policy in AWS IAM?
options: A policy that specifies which identities (users, services, or accounts) are allowed to assume a role, commonly used for cross-account access.
A policy attached to a user that allows them to assume roles in different AWS accounts.
A policy that defines permissions to access AWS resources from external services but only for AWS-managed resources like Lambda functions.
A policy that defines all actions permitted for an AWS accountâ€™s root user.
correct_answers: A policy that specifies which identities (users, services, or accounts) are allowed to assume a role, commonly used for cross-account access.
